heading: Congratulations to our showcase winners!
body:
Dear class,

I hope finals are treating you well. :) As we process final grades, I wanted to share a final thank you for a wonderful semester - I know that I can speak on behalf of our faculty and TAs when I express how much we fun we had learning alongside you all this spring. Thank you for all of your time and effort! 

Please join me as well in congratulating our Gunter Georgi and Nick Russo Award winners for this spring.

Gunter Georgi

HIR: Skyline Builders and Innovation (Section A2) -  Veer Choksi, Arda Dinc, and Jomyuth Luangtana-anan
RAD: RoboCaddy (Section E2) - Alex Huang, Jack Li, Samarth Pusegaonkar, and Jason Tung
VEX MRR: Top Dog Robotics (Section F3) - George Chorny, Jeremiah Duran, Justin Sun, and Alan Zhang
VEX LAZ: SAI LLC (Section G2) - Irika Aggarwal, Ishraq Basher, Sarah Niu, and Aksana Rodshi

Nick Russo
HIR:  Etchasia Rayboah Innovations (Section B1) - Anastasia Cruz, Indi Etchebarne, Raymond Li, and Blessing Yeboah
RAD: Code Blocks (Section E3) - Bill Li, Mitsuki Nakajima, and Dwayne Ong 

Happy summer,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Last Day of Open Lab
body:
Hello all!

This week if the final week of Open Lab and it will close at 6:00 p.m. on May 3rd. If you do not return your kit by this deadline, you will receive a grade of "I" in the gradebook. 

Good luck to those of you who are participating in the showcase and good luck with finals!

heading: The RAD Showcase is TODAY at 12:30pm!
body:
Dear class,

Happy Monday! 

If you are available, please join us in Pfizer Auditorium today at 12:30 PM to watch the final round of the RAD Showcase! Six teams will present their work and compete for the Gunter Georgi Award. All are welcome to attend!

Best,

Prof. Paredes

heading: RAD Kit Returns!
body:
Hey all,

The Open Lab (JABS 573) will be open for kit returns from  4/22 -5/3. Failure to return your kit will result in a grade of I (Incomplete) in EG-UY 1004: Introduction to Engineering and Design. If the I (Incomplete) is not resolved in a timely manner, the grade will convert to an F (Fail). If you have returned your kit, please disregard this message. Also as a reminder: If any RAD groups would like to continue their projects past this semester and keep any materials, you will have to submit this form.

Hope everyone had a great semester with the EG1004 team and good luck with finals!

heading: DEADLINE EXTENDED Keep Working On Your RAD Project
body:
To All RAD groups,

In light of the semester coming to a close, we wanted to encourage students to carry on their projects even after they have completed EG 1004. If a group wants to continue their project after the end of the semester and retain ownership of their prototype, they can fill out this form. Completion of this form doesn't guarantee that the group will get to keep the project. The final decision is made by EG 1004 administration. The deadline for completion is this Saturday 4/27.

Good luck to everyone this submission week!

heading: Apply to be a TA!
body:
Dear EG 1004 Students!

As we mentioned in lecture and recitation, we are now hiring TAs for future semesters of EG 1004 (starting Fall 2024). We are looking for enthusiastic TAs who are passionate about shaping future STEM professionals. The application can be found at https://eg.poly.edu/apply .

We are excited about your interest in making EG 1004 the best possible course for incoming first-year students at Tandon. Applications are open until 11:59 PM EDT on May 15, 2023. The interviews are expected to take place virtually over the summer. If you have any questions regarding the position or the process, feel free to reach out to your Teaching Assistants, Professors, or Head Teaching Assistants at eg1004@eg.poly.edu . Have a good semester!

heading: RSVP to the SLDP Showcase!
body:
Dear class,

Come support your peers at the SLDP Showcase on Monday, April 22, from 12:30 - 2 PM in JAB573! We have an exciting lineup of 27 teams across SLDPs - HIR, RAD, and VEX - ready to present posters and demonstrations of their work, and compete for our Gunter Georgi and Nick Russo Awards.

RSVP: https://lu.ma/j9mz3aw6
Light refreshments will be served.

heading: Upcoming Tandon Career Hub Event
body:
Dear EG students, 

Please see the below event from Tandon Career Hub.

===

Dear CBE students,

We are excited to announce that on Tuesday, April 23rd, NYU Tandon Career Hub x CBE Department will be hosting a CBE Alumni Panel + Networking Session. We are happy to welcome back several CBE alumni, who will share their experiences in graduate school, job searching, industry, and more. After the panel, you will also get a chance to ask each alum your own questions and build your network!Participating alumni come from various industries– like Oil & Gas, Pharmaceuticals, and Cosmetics– providing unique perspectives on CBE-related fields and potential career paths available to you. Our alumni panelists are below and you can read their bios here:

Abdullah Sayed: Senior Implementation Lead, Xeal
Cheuryon John: Engineer, Drug Product Innovation
Diya Mulay: Associate Engineer, Estee Lauder
Fariha Mahjabin: Energy Market Analyst, Enersponse LLC
Iqra Mirza: Project Engineer II, PowerFlex
Jakub Legocki: Associate Scientist, Merck

Please see details and registration information below.


Event Details
Date: Tuesday, April 23rd, 2024
Time: 6 PM
Location: 370 Jay Street, #1201
Food will be provided.
Register here by April 16th.

heading: Lecture 10 Attendance Issue
body:
Dear class,

I hope this email finds you well. Our team is aware that many of you are missing attendance for Lecture 10 from the gradebook. We are working to resolve this issue and will provide you all with an update soon.

Best,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Earth Day Celebration with Sustainable Engineering Initiative
body:
Dear class, 

Please see below for an invitation to Earth Day programming at Tandon from the Sustainable Engineering Initiative, led by Prof. Modestino in CBE who delivered lecture a few weeks ago. I am part of the planning committee of this event as well - I hope to see you there! :D
===

Celebrate Earth Day with the Sustainable Engineering Initiative! On Monday, 4/22, visit our Climate Cafe in the MakerSpace EventSpace and Foyer. From 5-7 PM, we’ll have:

• Poster presentations and teach talks about sustainability education efforts at Tandon

• Sustainability bingo hosted by TUSC

• Opportunities to share your experience with sustainability education at our school 

• Raffles for prizes!

Light refreshments will be served. RSVP at this link: https://lu.ma/vwt5fi37

heading: Showcase Application Deadline & Clarification
body:
Hi class,

The deadline to apply to the SLDP Showcase is TONIGHT! To apply, please provide this information using this application form by Thursday, April 4, 2024 at 11:59 PM ET. Teams will receive confirmation from our team by Friday, April 5, 2024 at 5 PM ET.

I also wanted to clarify expectations for the poster and printing. Approved teams will digitally design the posters (36 x 48) in software/websites like PowerPoint or Canva and submit a pdf to our team, which we will print on your behalf -- there is no expectation for teams to spend money on materials or printing costs.

If you have any further questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out!

Best,

Prof. Paredes

heading: DEADLINE EXTENDED: Apply to the SLDP Showcase!
body:
Dear class,

Hope you are staying dry today! As your recitation instructors may have mentioned today, we are extending the SLDP showcase deadline to Thursday, April 4, at 11:59 PM ET. Information about the showcase and application process can be found below. Please reach out to your recitation instructors in case you have any questions or concerns about the application. We look forward to reviewing them! :)

- Prof. Paredes

==

Dear class,

Our program is happy to announce the inaugural EG-1004 SLDP Showcase! Join us for a series of events that will celebrate your work and provide an opportunity for you to network with other students, faculty, and staff at Tandon.

The showcase will entail two rounds. In the first, qualifying round, teams will present posters and the physical prototypes of their work. A select number of teams will proceed to the second, final round, in which teams will present oral presentations of their projects. 

Finalists will have the opportunity to compete for our first place award, the Gunter Georgi Award, and second place award, the Nick Russo Award. These awards, named after the educators who established our course, celebrate excellence in design, innovation, and entrepreneurship. Recipients of the Nick Russo Award will receive $100 per team member. Recipients of the Gunter Georgi Award will receive $200 per team member and the opportunity to present their work to incoming first-year students at 2025 Convocation.

Due to limited time and space, participation in the SLDP showcase requires an application from all interested SLDP teams. For all SLDPs (HIR, RAD, LAZ, and MRR), the application requires:

Successful completion of Benchmark B

CAD renderings of your design in Fusion 360/Revit

A draft or copy of your Milestone 3 Presentation 

Photos and/or videos of your project, if available

Responses to a series of short-answer questions in the application form linked below

To apply, please provide this information using this application form by Thursday, April 4, 2024 at 11:59 PM ET.  Teams will receive confirmation from our team by Friday, April 5, 2024 at 5 PM ET.

You may view this announcement here as well for your convenience.

heading: NYU Climate and Sustainability Opinion Essay Competition
body:
Dear class,

Please see below for writing opportunity from the Expository Writing Program and NYU Office of Sustainability. If you have any questions, please e-mail Prof. Abby Rabinowitz at afr229@nyu.edu.

Best,

Prof. Paredes

===

You're invited to participate in the NYU Climate and Sustainability Opinion Essay Competition, hosted by the Expository Writing Program with support from NYU's Office of Sustainability. The competition deadline is Friday April 12, 11:59 p.m. Please visit this website for details: https://cas.nyu.edu/ewp/ewp-courses/Tandon/nyu-climate-and-sustainability-opinion-essay-competition.html

Winners will receive prizes, along with a chance to speak with an editor or writer committed to publishing on climate change, and to read their work at an NYU event to-be-announced. The competition is open to all enrolled NYU students, with three of the six prizes reserved for undergraduate entrants.To help writers prepare, EWP is hosting a free climate op-ed writing workshop on Wed. March 27 at 5 p.m. at this zoom link: https://nyu.zoom.us/j/94765904650  You're welcome to join!Of course, please let me know if you have any questions.

All the best,

Professor Rabinowitz

heading: Apply to the SLDP showcase!
body:
Dear class,

Our program is happy to announce the inaugural EG-1004 SLDP Showcase! Join us for a series of events that will celebrate your work and provide an opportunity for you to network with other students, faculty, and staff at Tandon.

The showcase will entail two rounds. In the first, qualifying round, teams will present posters and the physical prototypes of their work. A select number of teams will proceed to the second, final round, in which teams will present oral presentations of their projects. 

Finalists will have the opportunity to compete for our first place award, the Gunter Georgi Award, and second place award, the Nick Russo Award. These awards, named after the educators who established our course, celebrate excellence in design, innovation, and entrepreneurship. Recipients of the Nick Russo Award will receive $100 per team member. Recipients of the Gunter Georgi Award will receive $200 per team member and the opportunity to present their work to incoming first-year students at 2025 Convocation.

Due to limited time and space, participation in the SLDP showcase requires an application from all interested SLDP teams. For all SLDPs (HIR, RAD, LAZ, and MRR), the application requires:

Successful completion of Benchmark B

CAD renderings of your design in Fusion 360/Revit

A draft or copy of your Milestone 3 Presentation 

Photos and/or videos of your project, if available

Responses to a series of short-answer questions in the application form linked below

To apply, please provide this information using this application form by Tuesday, April 2, 2024 at 11:59 PM ET.  Teams will receive confirmation from our team by Friday, April 5, 2024 at 5 PM ET.

You may view this announcement here as well for your convenience.

heading: Lecture 8 Slides Uploaded + Weekly Announcements
body:
Dear class,

I missed you all today! I hope you had a restful spring break and enjoyed the lecture today from the Office of Sustainability and Sustainable Engineering Initiative. You can now find today's slides uploaded under the "Lecture" tab. A couple of announcements:

This week in lab, you will have a Model Shop Session -- essentially time to work on your SLDPs with the guidance of our TAs. Benchmark B will be due at the end of this session and as usual for lab, attendance is mandatory! Please make sure to tap in and out to ensure we have a proper record of your attendance.
SLDP Showcase Applications will be released tomorrow! Keep an eye out in your inboxes.
Thank you those of you who have already filled out the Mid-semester Course Feedback for our course. If you have not yet done so, please, please fill out the survey by tonight at 11:59 PM ET! The invitation should be in your inbox. Our faculty use this feedback to make improvements to our course, both during and between semesters. We truly appreciate your feedback.

See you next week,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Lecture 7 Slides Uploaded + Weekly Announcements
body:
Hi everyone!

You can now find today's slides uploaded under the "Lecture" tab. A couple of other announcements:

There will be no class next week. Happy spring break!
Open Lab (JAB573) will be open on a modified schedule. Please refer to the "Syllabus/Schedules" page for operating hours.
Revit 2024 is now available in Open Lab - thank you to our Systems Administration team for taking care of this! 
SLDP Showcase applications will be released around Benchmark B. I will include details in a separate announcement, but in the meantime, please reach out to me and your recitation instructors if you have any questions. We encourage everyone to apply!

Thanks and have a great week! See you soon,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Apply for RAD Innovation Grant!
body:
Hi everyone!

As mentioned in lecture, applications are now open for the RAD Innovation Grant. Open to all RAD groups, this grant can supplement your $100 budget to purchase items for completion of your projects.

If you have questions or concerns, please contact your recitation instructors. The application deadline is 03/31/24 at 11:59 PM ET.

Good luck on your projects!

heading: Lecture 6 Slides Uploaded + Weekly Announcements
body:
Hi class!

You can now find today's slides uploaded under the "Lecture" tab. A couple of other announcements:

Milestone 2 is this week! Good luck!
The Lab 2 Rewrite and Lab 7 Individual Report are extra credit opportunities that will replace the lower of your Lab 2 and Lab 3 grades, respectively. If you have any questions about this, please reach out to your recitation instructors.

Thanks and have a great week! See you soon,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Open Lab and Proto Lab Closure
body:
Hi all!


The Open Lab and Proto Lab will be closed during Lab sections E, F and G (2:00-5:00 pm) between 2/27 and 3/01. These changes are updated on the Open Lab Schedule on the EG website.

Best,
The General Engineering Team

heading: Gen 1 Airpods Left in Pfizer - 2/26/24
body:
Hi class,

We found a pair of gen 1 airpods today on the floor of Pfizer. If you are missing them, please e-mail me (ijparedes@nyu.edu) to coordinate pickup.

Ingrid

heading: Lecture 5 Slides Uploaded + Weekly Announcements
body:
Hi class!

You can now find today's slides uploaded under the "Lecture" tab. A couple of other announcements:

You all should have completed MakerSpace training! If you have not yet, or have any questions/concerns about the training, please reach out to your recitation instructors. 
This week in lab, you will have Model Shop Session 2 -- essentially time to work on your SLDPs with the guidance of our TAs. Benchmark A will be due at the end of this session and as usual for lab, attendance is mandatory!

Thanks and have a great week! See you soon,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Reminder: MakerSpace Training Deadline for E, F, & G
body:
Hi all,

Apologies for forgetting to send this out last week due to the snowstorm! For all students in groups E, F, and G (Sections E1, E2, E3, F1, F2, F3, and G1, G2, and G3), a reminder to please complete your MakerSpace orientation training by Friday, 2/23/24. The schedule for trainings can be found at https://makerspace.engineering.nyu.edu/.

For all other EG students, if you have not yet completed your training, please do so by no later than your Lab 6 session (Modelshop 2). If you are unable to schedule an appointment by that date, please reach out to your recitation instructors. 

Thank you,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Open Lab Schedule Reminder
body:
Hi all!

 

Hope the long weekend is treating you well. Despite the holiday this Monday, February 19th, Modelshop (JABS 573) will be open following the regular schedule posted on the website! 

 

Best,

The General Engineering Team

heading: Inclement Weather Plans for Tuesday, 2/13
body:
Hi everyone,

In line with the university's guidance, please note the following changes to course operations for tomorrow, Tuesday, 2/13.

Recitations for sections C1, C2, C3 and F1, F2, and F3 will be held remotely. Your recitation instructors will provide a Zoom link ahead of class time. Please sign in on time for class and be prepared to present your lab 3 presentations virtually with your teammates. As usual, if for any reason you are unable to attend class tomorrow, please e-mail your recitation instructors ahead of time.
EG Lab will be canceled for tomorrow. Sections A1, A2, A3 and E1, E2, and E3, please submit a Makeup Lab Request for Lab 4: Model Shop Session 1.
Your recitation instructors will approve the request once received. Note that Lab 4's sessions are introductory workshops for your projects, and you will receive important project information and materials during the makeup session.
If you planned to meet your RAD mentor during this time, please coordinate with them to either meet remotely or reschedule to a later date.
Open Lab will be closed tomorrow.

We will provide another update tomorrow regarding Wednesday's course operations, pending on the weather. In the meantime, if you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to your recitation instructors and cc me (ijparedes@nyu.edu).

Thank you, and stay safe!

heading: Modelshop Closing Reminder
body:
Hi all!

 

Modelshop will be closed during Lab sections E, F and G (2:00-5:00 pm) between 2/13 and 2/16. These changes are updated on the Open Lab Schedule on the EG website.

 

Best,

The General Engineering Team

heading: Items Left in Pfizer - 2/5/24
body:
Hi class,

I picked up a pair of AirPods and a winter hat from the first row of Pfizer today. If you left either of these items behind, please e-mail me at ijparedes@nyu.edu so we can coordinate a pick up time. I will also be in my office (RH305D) until 5 PM today.

Best,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Lecture 3 Slides Uploaded + Weekly Announcements
body:
Hi class!

You can now find today's slides uploaded under the "Lecture" tab. A couple of other announcements:

Students in Groups C + D (Sections C1, C2, and C3, and D1, D2 and D3), please complete your MakerSpace training by Friday, 2/9! If you are unable to schedule a training by this deadline, please schedule one at your earliest convenience and inform your recitation instructors.
SLDP applications are due tonight at 11:59 PM! If you have any questions, please reach out to your recitation instructors. Open Lab will be open until 8PM tonight for RAD ideation sessions.
This week in lab, you will complete Lab 3: Prototyping a Thermal Insulation Device with Microcontrollers - again, please review the manual page for Lab 3 ahead of your lab session; this information will help prepare you and your teammates, and be the basis of the quiz you will take at the start of the session.

Thanks and have a great week! See you soon,

Prof. Paredes

heading: SLDP Application Final Reminder
body:
Good Morning students!

 

Just a reminder to fill out the SLDP Application using this form, due tonight at 11:59 pm. If you are applying for RAD, make sure to attend a RAD ideation session in Open Lab (JABS 573), open till 8:00 pm today. 

 

Best,

The General Engineering Team

heading: RAD Ideation Sessions
body:
Good Afternoon EG1004 Students!

 

This is a general reminder that any SLDP groups interested in applying to RAD MUST attend a RAD Ideation session in the Open Lab (JABS 573) in order to submit their application. This application is due Monday, February 5th @ 11:59 PM. The Open Lab schedule is available under the Syllabus/Schedules Tab of the Course Information menu on the website. We encourage you to go and ideate as soon as possible to develop well thought out ideas and for ample time to fill out the application!

 

Best,

The General Engineering Team

heading: Updates to Housing & Innovation in Revit (HIR)
body:
Good morning EG!

I hope your weeks are going well. :) For our HIR teams, please note that we are currently updating the manual and presentations with project information and up-to-date requirements, as mentioned in lecture. The pages will be updated today. If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to your recitation instructors and research@eg.poly.edu.

Thank you,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Lecture 2 Slides Uploaded + Weekly Announcements
body:
Hi class!

You can now find today's slides uploaded under the "Lecture" tab. A couple of other announcements:

Students in Groups A + B (Sections A1, 2, and 3, and B1, 2 and 3), please complete your MakerSpace training by Friday, 2/2! If you are unable to schedule a training by this deadline, please schedule one at your earliest convenience and inform your recitation instructors.
This week in recitation, you will form groups for your SLDP. Please review the manual for information about your project options; your recitation instructors will also provide information in class tomorrow before you form teams.
This week in lab, you will complete Lab 2: CAD Competition - again, please review the manual page for Lab 2 ahead of your lab session; this information will help prepare you and your teammates, and be the basis of the quiz you will take at the start of the session.

Thanks and have a great week! See you soon,

Prof. Paredes

heading: Have a Fusion 360 Account
body:
Hi everyone,

As was discussed in lecture today, this week's lab (Lab 2) will be a competition using Autodesk Fusion 360. By the time you arrive in lab this week, your recitation instructors will have added you to our institutional license for the software.

Please set up your account prior to your lab session this week. Doing so will save you, your lab partners, and TAs time! If you have any questions, please reach out to your recitation instructors. Thanks and good luck with the competition!

heading: SLDP Application
body:
Hello All,

Here is the application form for your SLDP projects (RAD, VEX, and HIR). Please only fill out the application once you have formed your SLDP groups in recitation. The form is due by next Monday (02/05) 11:59PM EST.

If you are applying for RAD, your group will need to attend Open Lab and meet with a TA for a RAD ideation session. If you are first applying for VEX or HIR, but RAD is your second choice, you are highly encouraged to attend an ideation session! Open Lab times can be found on the EG website. Please contact your recitation TA if you have any questions!

If you need help finding inspiration for RAD project ideas, you can reference this document.

Good luck to everyone!

heading: Lecture 1 Slides Uploaded
body:
Hi everyone,

It was nice to meet you all today! You can now find today's slides under the "Lecture" tab. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to reach out. Have a great week!

- Prof. Paredes

heading: Welcome Students!
body:
Hello Everyone,

For staffing information for the course you may click on "Sections" found on the left menu portion of this webpage under the "Course Information" heading. Room numbers for recitations, labs, and lecture can also be found on this page. You may familiarize yourselves with all of the EG1004 TAs by clicking on "Teaching Assistants" and looking up your TAs by name. You may also search for your professors and writing consultants by clicking on "Professors" or "Writing Consultants".

You can view the syllabus and schedule from the the left menu portion of the webpage.

If you have any further questions regarding the course, assignments, staffing, or anything else you may direct them to gecentral@eg.poly.edu. Have a wonderful semester!

- The General Engineering Team
